example.question: Some researchers believe that beta-carotene, which is found in carrots, may help humans live longer lives. A few scientists designed an experiment in which one-hundred people would be asked to take a double dose of beta-carotene daily for two years and another hundred people were given a placebo, a sugar pill, for the same amount of time. After the two years, the scientists planned to collect the data and draw a conclusion. This is not a good example of a scientific study and was not done because

text: it does not have a testable hypothesis.

prompt:
Accurately answer the following question:

Some researchers believe that beta-carotene, which is found in carrots, may help humans live longer lives. A few scientists designed an experiment in which one-hundred people would be asked to take a double dose of beta-carotene daily for two years and another hundred people were given a placebo, a sugar pill, for the same amount of time. After the two years, the scientists planned to collect the data and draw a conclusion. This is not a good example of a scientific study and was not done because

Choices:
A. there is no control group.
B. there are too many variables.
C. there is no experimental group.
D. it does not have a testable hypothesis.


Instructions:
- Carefully read the question and all options.
- Select the single most correct answer.
- Respond ONLY in the following format: "The correct answer is A/B/C/D".
- Do not include any explanations, additional text, or punctuation besides the answer.

The correct answer is
